tr.td: Title:Star formation history in barred spiral galaxies: NGC 5430
Co-I(s): Simon Cantin, Anne Pellerin, Mercedes Molla, Hugo Martel, Stephanie Cote

body.div: Using IFU data, we have studied the history of stellar populations in the central region of 8 barred spiral galaxies. It shows young bursts located in nuclear bar/ring/spirals, non thermal emission, dust lanes, and multiple underlying old populations. The importance of the galaxy bar to bring new gas in the galaxy center is put forward. GMOS/IFU data, with high spatial resolution is proposed here to push further this study. We will concentrate on NGC5430, the more massive galaxy in our sample that offer high spatial resolution. These new data will describe the stellar populations and gas in regions located in the galaxy bar and arms. It will provide new constrains for the role of bar and interaction in the evolutionary history of galaxies.
